title: Full breakfast
summary: A full breakfast is a substantial cooked breakfast meal, often served in the United Kingdom and Ireland, that typically includes bacon, sausages, eggs, black pudding, baked beans, tomatoes, mushrooms, toast, and a beverage such as coffee or tea. It appears in different regional variants and is referred to by different names depending on the area. While it is colloquially known as a "fry up" in most areas of the UK and Ireland, it is usually referred to as a "full English" (often "full English breakfast"),[2] a "full Irish", "full Scottish",[3] "full Welsh",[4] "full Cornish", and "Ulster fry",[5] in England, the Republic of Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Cornwall, and Northern Ireland, respectively.
